content:
@nikomatsakis @Rajeev Joshi and Peter Muller are organizing
https://sites.google.com/view/rustverify2022/home
Deadline for talk/demo proposals: January 14, 2022 (Friday)
Notification of acceptance: February 07, 2022 (Monday)
Workshop: April 03, 2022 (Sunday)
That sounds fun! When does subscription open up for non-speakers or is there a feed/newsletter to watch for hearing more that you know of? :smile:
I expect inscriptions for attendees will open up in late January
You should look out for news about ETAPS
Thanks!

Btw @Xavier Denis , if I remember correctly, during your presentation for RFMIG you mentioned that you are currently working on a paper about Cruseot. Would you be able to share an insight on when you're planning to publish it? I'm looking forward to that one :)
We’re working on publishing the preprint while reviews are ongoing
I can send it to you when that’s done (very soon)
There’s also another paper on our meta theory but I don’t think we’ll publish preprints of that one for now
Thank you! :grinning:

Xavier Denis said:

You should look out for news about ETAPS

Looks like registration just opened up! https://etaps.org/2022/registration

Is anyone here planning to go there in Munich? :)
I’ll be presenting so there’s a good chance I’ll be there
At which of the conferences/workshops is your presentation?
I was originally just looking at just the workshops but I only just realized there is a bunch of other stuff going on there that week too :D
for RustVerify
I'll be talking about all the progress we've made over hte past year in Creusot
Awesome :)
@nikomatsakis @Rajeev Joshi When will the list of accepted presentations be available?
Does anyone have any idea of timing for RVW? I am looking at availability of flights, so I need to decide if I should fly out on Saturday or possibly Sunday morning... Thanks, Rod

Roderick Chapman said:

Does anyone have any idea of timing for RVW? I am looking at availability of flights, so I need to decide if I should fly out on Saturday or possibly Sunday morning... Thanks, Rod

The website says it is on 3 Apr, 2022 (Sun). Or do you mean the hours?
The hours... I need to decide if and when to fly...

Bas Spitters said:

nikomatsakis Rajeev Joshi When will the list of accepted presentations be available?

Hi Bas: We'll be putting up the list of accepted talks later today (Feb 17) on the workshop web site.

Roderick Chapman said:

The hours... I need to decide if and when to fly...

Hi, Rod: We're waiting to hear back from the ETAPS chairs, but it's a full day workshop, so starting around 8:30 a.m. (maybe even 8?) would be my guess.

OK... that means fly out on Saturday then...
Is there a recommended hotel at or near the venue?

Roderick Chapman said:

Is there a recommended hotel at or near the venue?

Yes, the ETAPS homepage lists a few, one of them is directly on the campus (< 5 min walk away from the venue). https://etaps.org/2022/travel-and-accommodation

Bas Spitters said:

nikomatsakis Rajeev Joshi When will the list of accepted presentations be available?

I've just updated the workshop page with the list of accepted speakers. Note that this is not the final schedule; we're still working on that.
Please note that the early registration deadline for the the workshop (and ETAPS) is this Sunday, Feb 20. You can find registration information here.
@Rajeev Joshi does that apply to the student price as well?
Ah my bad I see it does
Besides purchasing the ETAPS workshop ticket for Sunday Apr 3rd, do we also need to explicitly register somewhere for RustVerify or are all workshops on a "walk-in" basis?

Hi, all: We've just published the draft schedule on the workshop site: https:/sites.google.com/view/rustverify2022

Speakers: Please have a look and let us know if you can't make your assigned speaking slot.
I don't know if you can answer this, but I'll also be attending VerifyThis which is Sat-Sun, do you know if there will be a schedule conflict?
They haven't published their programme yet

Pointerbender said:

Besides purchasing the ETAPS workshop ticket for Sunday Apr 3rd, do we also need to explicitly register somewhere for RustVerify or are all workshops on a "walk-in" basis?

I heard back from LMU, all workshops are on a walk-in basis. To give the organizers an idea of how many people will attend each workshop, there is a Xing page where you can let know your workshop preference, but it's not a requirement for entering the workshops.

Hi, all: The 2nd Rust Verification Workshop is this Sunday, Apr 3. Hope to see many of you there! One new thing we're trying this year is a session with 5-minute Lightning Talks. Please contact me if you're interested in giving a Lightning Talk.
Looking forward to meeting some of y'all tomorrow and sunday!

The program looks exciting! Unfortunately, I won't be able to attend.
Maybe the speakers can post their slides/papers here, so we can continue the discussion.
Do we know if the talks were recorded? I can't find it on the website https://sites.google.com/view/rustverify2022/home
I hope they were, I want to see some that I missed since they were too early in my timezone :)
They were all over zoom, so there is hope…

Julien Cretin (ia0) said:

Do we know if the talks were recorded? I can't find it on the website https://sites.google.com/view/rustverify2022/home

They were not recorded.
